# Analysis of Ecological Data: Exploratory and Euclidean Methods in Environmental Sciences (**ade4**)

[![CRAN_Release_Badge](http://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version-ago/ade4)](http://cran.r-project.org/package=ade4)
[![CRAN
Downloads](https://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/ade4)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=ade4)
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/adeverse/ade4/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/adeverse/ade4/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml)
[![License: GPL
v3](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-GPLv3-blue.svg)](https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0)

## Presentation

**ade4** is a software developed in the Biometry and Evolutionary
Biology Lab (UMR 5558) - University Lyon 1 for the **D**ata **A**nalysis
of **E**cological and **E**nvironmental data in the framework of
**E**uclidean **E**xploratory methods, hence the name **ade4**.

**ade4** is a package for the [**R**
software](https://www.r-project.org) since 2002. It contains functions
for exploratory multivariate data analysis and graphical display, many
numerical data sets and bibliographic references. Simple one-table
methods are described in [Chessel et
al.¬†(2004)](http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/JTHome/ref/ade4-Rnews.pdf).
Two-table and K-table methods are described in [Dray et
al.¬†(2007)](http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/ade4/article/rnews2/rnews2.pdf).
The theory of the duality diagram and its implementation in ade4 are
discussed in [Dray et Dufour
(2007)](http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/ade4/article/jss/jss.pdf).

A book in the *Springer Series in Statistics* collection,
[**‚ÄúMultivariate Analysis of Ecological Data with
ade4‚Äù**](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/book.md) presents the
package. The examples and the graphs in this book can be [**reproduced
online
here**](https://lbbe-shiny.univ-lyon1.fr/Reproducible_Research/Book/).

The **ade4shiny** dashboard allows you to use the basic functions of the
**ade4** package online, directly in your browser: no need to install
**R** and the necessary packages on your computer.
[**ade4shiny**](https://lbbe-shiny.univ-lyon1.fr/ade4shiny/)

If you use **ade4**, please consider citing [these
references](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/authors.html#citation) !

[![](https://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/members/thioulouse/github/Book.png)](https://www.springer.com/fr/book/9781493988488)
[![](https://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/members/thioulouse/github/ade4Shiny1.png)](https://lbbe-shiny.univ-lyon1.fr/ade4shiny/)
[![](https://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/members/thioulouse/github/ade4Shiny2.png)](https://lbbe-shiny.univ-lyon1.fr/ade4shiny/)

## Getting started with **ade4**

### Installing **ade4**

[This page](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/install.md) explains
how to install the **ade4** package in **R**.

### Vignettes

Several vignettes are available to help you get started with **ade4**
(more to come soon !):

- [Graphical representation of multivariate
  data](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/adegraphics/vignettes/adegraphics.html)

- [Description of environmental variables
  structures](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/ChapEnvVarStruct.md)

- [Description of species
  structures](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/ChapSpeciesStruct.md)

- [Taking into account groups of
  sites](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/ChapBetGr.md)

- [Description of species-environment
  relationships](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/Chap2tables.md)

- [Analysing Changes in
  Structures](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/ChapKtables.md)

- [Analysing Changes in
  Co-structures](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/Chap2Ktables.md)

### List of function references

You can also find a list of functions available to users on the
[reference page](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/reference/index.md).

### Other resources

Check out the [ade4
book](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/book.md) and its [shiny
application](https://lbbe-shiny.univ-lyon1.fr/Reproducible_Research/Book/)
for a complete introduction to the package and to rerun the code present
in the book. You can also check these [bibliographic
references](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/papers.md) to help
you understand **ade4** methods.

Note for nostalgics üòâ : the **old ade4 web site** is still available
here:
[http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/ADE-4/](http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/ADE-4/accueil2.php).

### Using **ade4** online: the Shiny app

Consider giving a try to our shiny app, developed to allow you to run an
analysis without having to write your own script:
[ade4shiny](https://lbbe-shiny.univ-lyon1.fr/ade4shiny/). You will be
able to download the R script used to generate the results as well as
the analyses outputs and graphical representations.

### Getting help: FAQ & Mailing list

You can also check the [FAQ
section](http://adeverse.github.io/ade4/articles/faq.md) to check if
your question has already been answered or ask for help on the **ade4**
mailing list
[adelist](https://listes.univ-lyon1.fr/sympa/info/adelist).  

# Package index

## One-table analysis

These functions are designed for the analysis of a single table.

### Methods

Functions to run the analysis

- [`dudi.acm()`](dudi.acm.md) [`acm.burt()`](dudi.acm.md)
  [`acm.disjonctif()`](dudi.acm.md)
  [`boxplot(`*`<acm>`*`)`](dudi.acm.md) : Multiple Correspondence
  Analysis
- [`dudi.coa()`](dudi.coa.md) : Correspondence Analysis
- [`dudi.dec()`](dudi.dec.md) : Decentred Correspondence Analysis
- [`prep.fuzzy.var()`](dudi.fca.md) [`dudi.fca()`](dudi.fca.md)
  [`dudi.fpca()`](dudi.fca.md) : Fuzzy Correspondence Analysis and Fuzzy
  Principal Components Analysis
- [`dudi.hillsmith()`](dudi.hillsmith.md) : Ordination of Tables mixing
  quantitative variables and factors
- [`dudi.mix()`](dudi.mix.md) : Ordination of Tables mixing quantitative
  variables and factors
- [`dudi.nsc()`](dudi.nsc.md) : Non symmetric correspondence analysis
- [`dudi.pca()`](dudi.pca.md) : Principal Component Analysis
- [`dudi.pco()`](dudi.pco.md) [`scatter(`*`<pco>`*`)`](dudi.pco.md) :
  Principal Coordinates Analysis
- [`pcoscaled()`](pcoscaled.md) : Simplified Analysis in Principal
  Coordinates
- [`nipals()`](nipals.md) [`scatter(`*`<nipals>`*`)`](nipals.md)
  [`print(`*`<nipals>`*`)`](nipals.md) : Non-linear Iterative Partial
  Least Squares (NIPALS) algorithm

### Graphics

Functions to display the results of the analysis

- [`score(`*`<coa>`*`)`](score.coa.md)
  [`reciprocal.coa()`](score.coa.md) : Reciprocal scaling after a
  correspondence analysis
- [`scatter()`](scatter.md) [`biplot(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](scatter.md)
  [`screeplot(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](scatter.md) : Graphical representation of
  the outputs of a multivariate analysis
- [`scatter(`*`<acm>`*`)`](scatter.acm.md) : Plot of the factorial maps
  in a Multiple Correspondence Analysis
- [`scatter(`*`<coa>`*`)`](scatter.coa.md) : Plot of the factorial maps
  for a correspondence analysis
- [`scatter(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](scatter.dudi.md) : Plot of the Factorial
  Maps
- [`scatter(`*`<fca>`*`)`](scatter.fca.md) : Plot of the factorial maps
  for a fuzzy correspondence analysis
- [`score()`](score.md) [`scoreutil.base()`](score.md) : Graphs for One
  Dimension
- [`score(`*`<acm>`*`)`](score.acm.md) : Graphs to study one factor in a
  Multiple Correspondence Analysis
- [`score(`*`<mix>`*`)`](score.mix.md) : Graphs to Analyse a factor in a
  Mixed Analysis
- [`score(`*`<pca>`*`)`](score.pca.md) : Graphs to Analyse a factor in
  PCA

## Two-table analysis

These functions are designed for the analysis of a pair of tables.

### Methods

Functions to run the analysis

- [`coinertia()`](coinertia.md)
  [`plot(`*`<coinertia>`*`)`](coinertia.md)
  [`print(`*`<coinertia>`*`)`](coinertia.md)
  [`summary(`*`<coinertia>`*`)`](coinertia.md) : Coinertia Analysis
- [`pcaiv()`](pcaiv.md) [`plot(`*`<pcaiv>`*`)`](pcaiv.md)
  [`print(`*`<pcaiv>`*`)`](pcaiv.md)
  [`summary(`*`<pcaiv>`*`)`](pcaiv.md) : Principal component analysis
  with respect to instrumental variables
- [`pcaivortho()`](pcaivortho.md)
  [`summary(`*`<pcaivortho>`*`)`](pcaivortho.md) : Principal Component
  Analysis with respect to orthogonal instrumental variables
- [`procuste()`](procuste.md) [`plot(`*`<procuste>`*`)`](procuste.md)
  [`print(`*`<procuste>`*`)`](procuste.md)
  [`randtest(`*`<procuste>`*`)`](procuste.md) : Simple Procruste
  Rotation between two sets of points
- [`niche()`](niche.md) [`print(`*`<niche>`*`)`](niche.md)
  [`plot(`*`<niche>`*`)`](niche.md) [`niche.param()`](niche.md)
  [`rtest(`*`<niche>`*`)`](niche.md) : Method to Analyse a pair of
  tables : Environmental and Faunistic Data
- [`varipart()`](varipart.md) [`print(`*`<varipart>`*`)`](varipart.md) :
  Partition of the variation of a response multivariate table by 2
  explanatory tables

### Tests

Functions to evaluate the significance of observed structures

- [`procuste.randtest()`](procuste.randtest.md) : Monte-Carlo Test on
  the sum of the singular values of a procustean rotation (in C).
- [`procuste.rtest()`](procuste.rtest.md) : Monte-Carlo Test on the sum
  of the singular values of a procustean rotation (in R).
- [`randtest(`*`<coinertia>`*`)`](randtest.coinertia.md) : Monte-Carlo
  test on a Co-inertia analysis (in C).
- [`randtest(`*`<pcaiv>`*`)`](randtest.pcaiv.md)
  [`randtest(`*`<pcaivortho>`*`)`](randtest.pcaiv.md) : Monte-Carlo Test
  on the percentage of explained (i.e. constrained) inertia
- [`RV.randtest()`](RV.randtest.md) : Monte-Carlo Test on the sum of
  eigenvalues of a co-inertia analysis (in C++ with Rcpp).
- [`RV.rtest()`](RV.rtest.md) : Monte-Carlo Test on the sum of
  eigenvalues of a co-inertia analysis (in R).
- [`RVintra.randtest()`](RVintra.randtest.md) : Monte-Carlo Test on the
  sum of eigenvalues of a within-class co-inertia analysis (in C++ with
  Rcpp).

## Three-table methods

3-tables methods.

- [`combine.randtest.rlq()`](combine.4thcorner.md)
  [`combine.4thcorner()`](combine.4thcorner.md)
  [`p.adjust.4thcorner()`](combine.4thcorner.md) : Functions to combine
  and adjust the outputs 3-table methods
- [`dpcaiv()`](dpcaiv.md) [`plot(`*`<dpcaiv>`*`)`](dpcaiv.md)
  [`print(`*`<dpcaiv>`*`)`](dpcaiv.md)
  [`summary(`*`<dpcaiv>`*`)`](dpcaiv.md)
  [`randtest(`*`<dpcaiv>`*`)`](dpcaiv.md) [`dvaripart()`](dpcaiv.md)
  [`print(`*`<dvaripart>`*`)`](dpcaiv.md) : Double principal component
  analysis with respect to instrumental variables
- [`fourthcorner`](fourthcorner.md) [`fourthcorner2`](fourthcorner.md)
  [`print.4thcorner`](fourthcorner.md)
  [`summary.4thcorner`](fourthcorner.md)
  [`plot.4thcorner`](fourthcorner.md)
  [`fourthcorner.rlq`](fourthcorner.md) : Functions to compute the
  fourth-corner statistic
- [`rlq()`](rlq.md) [`print(`*`<rlq>`*`)`](rlq.md)
  [`plot(`*`<rlq>`*`)`](rlq.md) [`summary(`*`<rlq>`*`)`](rlq.md)
  [`randtest(`*`<rlq>`*`)`](rlq.md) : RLQ analysis

## Analysis including categorical variables (`factor`)

These functions allows to consider a partition of individuals to focus
on or remove differences between groups.

### Methods

- [`bca(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](bca.md) : Between-Class Analysis
- [`bca(`*`<coinertia>`*`)`](bca.coinertia.md) : Between-class coinertia
  analysis
- [`bca(`*`<rlq>`*`)`](bca.rlq.md) [`plot(`*`<betrlq>`*`)`](bca.rlq.md)
  [`print(`*`<betrlq>`*`)`](bca.rlq.md) : Between-Class RLQ analysis
- [`bwca.dpcoa()`](bwca.dpcoa.md) [`bca(`*`<dpcoa>`*`)`](bwca.dpcoa.md)
  [`wca(`*`<dpcoa>`*`)`](bwca.dpcoa.md)
  [`randtest(`*`<betwit>`*`)`](bwca.dpcoa.md)
  [`summary(`*`<betwit>`*`)`](bwca.dpcoa.md)
  [`print(`*`<witdpcoa>`*`)`](bwca.dpcoa.md)
  [`print(`*`<betdpcoa>`*`)`](bwca.dpcoa.md) : Between- and within-class
  double principal coordinate analysis
- [`discrimin()`](discrimin.md)
  [`plot(`*`<discrimin>`*`)`](discrimin.md)
  [`print(`*`<discrimin>`*`)`](discrimin.md) : Linear Discriminant
  Analysis (descriptive statistic)
- [`discrimin.coa()`](discrimin.coa.md) : Discriminant Correspondence
  Analysis
- [`wca(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](wca.md) : Within-Class Analysis
- [`wca(`*`<coinertia>`*`)`](wca.coinertia.md) : Within-class coinertia
  analysis
- [`wca(`*`<rlq>`*`)`](wca.rlq.md) [`plot(`*`<witrlq>`*`)`](wca.rlq.md)
  [`print(`*`<witrlq>`*`)`](wca.rlq.md) : Within-Class RLQ analysis
- [`withinpca()`](withinpca.md) : Normed within principal component
  analysis
- [`witwit.coa()`](witwit.coa.md)
  [`summary(`*`<witwit>`*`)`](witwit.coa.md)
  [`witwitsepan()`](witwit.coa.md) : Internal Correspondence Analysis

### Additional tools

- [`loocv(`*`<between>`*`)`](loocv.bca.md)
  [`print(`*`<bcaloocv>`*`)`](loocv.bca.md)
  [`plot(`*`<bcaloocv>`*`)`](loocv.bca.md) :

  Leave-one-out cross-validation for a `bca`

- [`loocv(`*`<discrimin>`*`)`](loocv.discrimin.md)
  [`print(`*`<discloocv>`*`)`](loocv.discrimin.md)
  [`plot(`*`<discloocv>`*`)`](loocv.discrimin.md) :

  Leave-one-out cross-validation for a `discrimin` analysis

- [`randtest(`*`<between>`*`)`](randtest.between.md) : Monte-Carlo Test
  on the between-groups inertia percentage (in C).

- [`randtest(`*`<discrimin>`*`)`](randtest.discrimin.md) : Monte-Carlo
  Test on a Discriminant Analysis (in C).

- [`rtest(`*`<between>`*`)`](rtest.between.md) : Monte-Carlo Test on the
  between-groups inertia percentage (in R).

- [`rtest(`*`<discrimin>`*`)`](rtest.discrimin.md) : Monte-Carlo Test on
  a Discriminant Analysis (in R).

## Management of `dudi` objects

These functions provides functionalities to manage objects of the class
`dudi` (they can be used on the outputs od several methods to analyze
one or two tables for instance).

- [`as.dudi()`](dudi.md) [`print(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](dudi.md)
  [`is.dudi()`](dudi.md) [`redo.dudi()`](dudi.md)
  [`t(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](dudi.md) [`summary(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](dudi.md)
  [`` `[`( ``*`<dudi>`*`)`](dudi.md) : Duality Diagram

- [`scatter()`](scatter.md) [`biplot(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](scatter.md)
  [`screeplot(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](scatter.md) : Graphical representation of
  the outputs of a multivariate analysis

- [`dist.dudi()`](dist.dudi.md) : Computation of the Distance Matrix
  from a Statistical Triplet

- [`inertia(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](inertia.dudi.md)
  [`print(`*`<inertia>`*`)`](inertia.dudi.md)
  [`summary(`*`<inertia>`*`)`](inertia.dudi.md) : Decomposition of
  inertia (i.e. contributions) in multivariate methods

- [`loocv(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](loocv.dudi.md) :

  Leave-one-out cross-validation for a `dudi`

- [`reconst()`](reconst.md) : Reconstitution of Data from a Duality
  Diagram

- [`supcol()`](supcol.md) : Projections of Supplementary Columns

- [`suprow(`*`<coa>`*`)`](suprow.md) [`suprow(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](suprow.md)
  [`predict(`*`<dudi>`*`)`](suprow.md)
  [`suprow(`*`<pca>`*`)`](suprow.md) [`suprow(`*`<acm>`*`)`](suprow.md)
  [`suprow(`*`<mix>`*`)`](suprow.md) [`suprow(`*`<fca>`*`)`](suprow.md)
  : Projections of Supplementary Rows

- [`testdim()`](testdim.md) : Function to perform a test of
  dimensionality

## K-table analysis

Functions designed to manage and analyze data structured in several
tables (a.k.a. multitable analysis)

### Methods

Functions to run the analysis

- [`costatis()`](costatis.md) : STATIS and Co-Inertia : Analysis of a
  series of paired ecological tables
- [`foucart()`](foucart.md) [`plot(`*`<foucart>`*`)`](foucart.md)
  [`print(`*`<foucart>`*`)`](foucart.md) : K-tables Correspondence
  Analysis with the same rows and the same columns
- [`mdpcoa()`](mdpcoa.md) [`kplotX.mdpcoa()`](mdpcoa.md)
  [`prep.mdpcoa()`](mdpcoa.md) : Multiple Double Principal Coordinate
  Analysis
- [`mbpls()`](mbpls.md) : Multiblock partial least squares
- [`mbpcaiv()`](mbpcaiv.md) : Multiblock principal component analysis
  with instrumental variables
- [`mcoa()`](mcoa.md) [`print(`*`<mcoa>`*`)`](mcoa.md)
  [`summary(`*`<mcoa>`*`)`](mcoa.md) [`plot(`*`<mcoa>`*`)`](mcoa.md) :
  Multiple CO-inertia Analysis
- [`mfa()`](mfa.md) [`plot(`*`<mfa>`*`)`](mfa.md)
  [`print(`*`<mfa>`*`)`](mfa.md) [`summary(`*`<mfa>`*`)`](mfa.md) :
  Multiple Factorial Analysis
- [`pta()`](pta.md) [`plot(`*`<pta>`*`)`](pta.md)
  [`print(`*`<pta>`*`)`](pta.md) : Partial Triadic Analysis of a
  K-tables
- [`sepan()`](sepan.md) [`plot(`*`<sepan>`*`)`](sepan.md)
  [`summary(`*`<sepan>`*`)`](sepan.md)
  [`print(`*`<sepan>`*`)`](sepan.md) : Separated Analyses in a K-tables
- [`statico()`](statico.md) : STATIS and Co-Inertia : Analysis of a
  series of paired ecological tables
- [`statis()`](statis.md) [`plot(`*`<statis>`*`)`](statis.md)
  [`print(`*`<statis>`*`)`](statis.md) : STATIS, a method for analysing
  K-tables

### Graphics

Functions to display the results of the analysis

- [`kplot()`](kplot.md) : Generic Function for Multiple Graphs in a
  K-tables Analysis
- [`kplot(`*`<foucart>`*`)`](kplot.foucart.md) : Multiple Graphs for the
  Foucart's Correspondence Analysis
- [`kplot(`*`<mcoa>`*`)`](kplot.mcoa.md) : Multiple Graphs for a
  Multiple Co-inertia Analysis
- [`kplot(`*`<mfa>`*`)`](kplot.mfa.md) : Multiple Graphs for a Multiple
  Factorial Analysis
- [`kplot(`*`<pta>`*`)`](kplot.pta.md) : Multiple Graphs for a Partial
  Triadic Analysis
- [`kplot(`*`<sepan>`*`)`](kplot.sepan.md)
  [`kplotsepan.coa()`](kplot.sepan.md) : Multiple Graphs for Separated
  Analyses in a K-tables
- [`kplot(`*`<statis>`*`)`](kplot.statis.md) : Multiple Graphs of a
  STATIS Analysis
- [`mdpcoa()`](mdpcoa.md) [`kplotX.mdpcoa()`](mdpcoa.md)
  [`prep.mdpcoa()`](mdpcoa.md) : Multiple Double Principal Coordinate
  Analysis
- [`summary(`*`<multiblock>`*`)`](multiblock.md)
  [`print(`*`<multiblock>`*`)`](multiblock.md) : Display and summarize
  multiblock objects

### Utilities

Functions to manage objects of class `ktab`

- [`c(`*`<ktab>`*`)`](ktab.md) [`` `[`( ``*`<ktab>`*`)`](ktab.md)
  [`is.ktab()`](ktab.md) [`t(`*`<ktab>`*`)`](ktab.md)
  [`row.names(`*`<ktab>`*`)`](ktab.md) [`tab.names()`](ktab.md)
  [`col.names()`](ktab.md) [`ktab.util.names()`](ktab.md) : the class of
  objects 'ktab' (K-tables)
- [`ktab.data.frame()`](ktab.data.frame.md) : Creation of K-tables from
  a data frame
- [`ktab.list.df()`](ktab.list.df.md) : Creating a K-tables from a list
  of data frames.
- [`ktab.list.dudi()`](ktab.list.dudi.md) : Creation of a K-tables from
  a list of duality diagrams
- [`ktab.match2ktabs()`](ktab.match2ktabs.md) : STATIS and Co-Inertia :
  Analysis of a series of paired ecological tables
- [`ktab.within()`](ktab.within.md) : Process to go from a Within
  Analysis to a K-tables
- [`mdpcoa()`](mdpcoa.md) [`kplotX.mdpcoa()`](mdpcoa.md)
  [`prep.mdpcoa()`](mdpcoa.md) : Multiple Double Principal Coordinate
  Analysis
- [`suprow(`*`<pta>`*`)`](suprow.pta.md) : Projections of Supplementary
  Rows for a Partial Triadic Analysis of K-tables

### Tests

Functions to evaluate the significance of observed structures

- [`costatis.randtest()`](costatis.randtest.md) : Monte-Carlo test on a
  Costatis analysis (in C).
- [`randboot(`*`<multiblock>`*`)`](randboot.multiblock.md) : Bootstraped
  simulations for multiblock methods
- [`testdim(`*`<multiblock>`*`)`](testdim.multiblock.md) : Selection of
  the number of dimension by two-fold cross-validation for multiblock
  methods
- [`statico.krandtest()`](statico.krandtest.md) : Monte-Carlo test on a
  Statico analysis (in C).

## Distance methods

- [`cailliez()`](cailliez.md) : Transformation to make Euclidean a
  distance matrix
- [`dist.binary()`](dist.binary.md) : Computation of Distance Matrices
  for Binary Data
- [`dist.dudi()`](dist.dudi.md) : Computation of the Distance Matrix
  from a Statistical Triplet
- [`dist.ktab()`](dist.ktab.md) [`ldist.ktab()`](dist.ktab.md)
  [`kdist.cor()`](dist.ktab.md) [`prep.fuzzy()`](dist.ktab.md)
  [`prep.binary()`](dist.ktab.md) [`prep.circular()`](dist.ktab.md) :
  Mixed-variables coefficient of distance
- [`dist.neig()`](dist.neig.md) : Computation of the Distance Matrix
  associated to a Neighbouring Graph
- [`dist.prop()`](dist.prop.md) : Computation of Distance Matrices of
  Percentage Data
- [`dist.quant()`](dist.quant.md) : Computation of Distance Matrices on
  Quantitative Variables
- [`as.taxo()`](as.taxo.md) [`dist.taxo()`](as.taxo.md) : Taxonomy
- [`dudi.pco()`](dudi.pco.md) [`scatter(`*`<pco>`*`)`](dudi.pco.md) :
  Principal Coordinates Analysis
- [`kdist()`](kdist.md) : the class of objects 'kdist' (K distance
  matrices)
- [`kdist2ktab()`](kdist2ktab.md) : Transformation of K distance
  matrices (object 'kdist') into K Euclidean representations (object
  'ktab')
- [`kdisteuclid()`](kdisteuclid.md) : a way to obtain Euclidean distance
  matrices
- [`mantel.randtest()`](mantel.randtest.md) : Mantel test (correlation
  between two distance matrices (in C).)
- [`mantel.rtest()`](mantel.rtest.md) : Mantel test (correlation between
  two distance matrices (in R).)
- [`mantelkdist()`](corkdist.md) [`RVkdist()`](corkdist.md)
  [`plot(`*`<corkdist>`*`)`](corkdist.md) : Tests of randomization
  between distances applied to 'kdist' objetcs
- [`quasieuclid()`](quasieuclid.md) : Transformation of a distance
  matrice to a Euclidean one
- [`RVdist.randtest()`](RVdist.randtest.md) : Tests of randomization on
  the correlation between two distance matrices (in R).
- [`supdist()`](supdist.md) : Projection of additional items in a PCO
  analysis
- [`table.dist()`](table.dist.md) : Graph Display for Distance Matrices
- [`is.euclid()`](is.euclid.md) [`summary(`*`<dist>`*`)`](is.euclid.md)
  : Is a Distance Matrix Euclidean?
- [`lingoes()`](lingoes.md) : Transformation of a Distance Matrix for
  becoming Euclidean
- [`mstree()`](mstree.md) : Minimal Spanning Tree
- [`pcoscaled()`](pcoscaled.md) : Simplified Analysis in Principal
  Coordinates

## Graphics

Functions to draw graphics. See functions of the package `adegraphics`
for a more flexible implementation based on `lattice`.

### 1D plot

- [`sco.boxplot()`](sco.boxplot.md) : Representation of the link between
  a variable and a set of qualitative variables
- [`sco.class()`](sco.class.md) : 1D plot of a numeric score and a
  factor with labels
- [`sco.distri()`](sco.distri.md) : Representation by mean- standard
  deviation of a set of weight distributions on a numeric score
- [`sco.gauss()`](sco.gauss.md) : Relationships between one score and
  qualitative variables
- [`sco.quant()`](sco.quant.md) : Graph to Analyse the Relation between
  a Score and Quantitative Variables
- [`sco.label()`](sco.label.md) : 1D plot of a numeric score with labels
- [`sco.match()`](sco.match.md) : 1D plot of a pair of numeric scores
  with labels

### 2D plot

- [`s.arrow()`](s.arrow.md) : Plot of the factorial maps for the
  projection of a vector basis
- [`s.chull()`](s.chull.md) : Plot of the factorial maps with polygons
  of contour by level of a factor
- [`s.class()`](s.class.md) : Plot of factorial maps with representation
  of point classes
- [`s.corcircle()`](s.corcircle.md) : Plot of the factorial maps of a
  correlation circle
- [`s.distri()`](s.distri.md) : Plot of a frequency distribution
- [`s.hist()`](s.hist.md) : Display of a scatterplot and its two
  marginal histograms
- [`s.image()`](s.image.md) : Graph of a variable using image and
  contour
- [`s.kde2d()`](s.kde2d.md) : Scatter Plot with Kernel Density Estimate
- [`s.label()`](s.label.md) : Scatter Plot
- [`s.logo()`](s.logo.md) : Representation of an object in a graph by a
  picture
- [`s.match()`](s.match.md) : Plot of Paired Coordinates
- [`s.match.class()`](s.match.class.md) : Scatterplot of two sets of
  coordinates and a partionning into classes
- [`s.multinom()`](s.multinom.md) : Graph of frequency profiles (useful
  for instance in genetic)
- [`s.traject()`](s.traject.md) : Trajectory Plot
- [`s.value()`](s.value.md) : Representation of a value in a graph

### Other types of plot

- [`dotcircle()`](dotcircle.md) : Representation of n values on a circle
- [`table.cont()`](table.cont.md) : Plot of Contingency Tables
- [`table.dist()`](table.dist.md) : Graph Display for Distance Matrices
- [`table.paint()`](table.paint.md) : Plot of the arrays by grey levels
- [`table.value()`](table.value.md) : Plot of the Arrays
- [`triangle.plot()`](triangle.plot.md)
  [`triangle.biplot()`](triangle.plot.md) : Triangular Plotting
- [`triangle.class()`](triangle.class.md) : Triangular Representation
  and Groups of points

### Utilities

These functions are mainly designed for internal use.

- [`add.scatter()`](add.scatter.md)
  [`add.scatter.eig()`](add.scatter.md) : Add graphics to an existing
  plot
- [`scatterutil`](scatterutil.md) [`scatterutil.base`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.sco`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.chull`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.eigen`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.ellipse`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.eti.circ`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.eti`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.grid`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.legend.bw.square`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.legend.square.grey`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.legendgris`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.scaling`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.star`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.sub`](scatterutil.md)
  [`scatterutil.convrot90`](scatterutil.md) : Graphical utility
  functions
- [`s.logo()`](s.logo.md) : Representation of an object in a graph by a
  picture

### Diversity

Functions focusing on the measurment of diversity. See also the package
`adiv` for more functionalities.

- [`amova()`](amova.md) [`print(`*`<amova>`*`)`](amova.md) : Analysis of
  molecular variance
- [`apqe()`](apqe.md) [`print(`*`<apqe>`*`)`](apqe.md) : Apportionment
  of Quadratic Entropy
- [`disc()`](disc.md) : Rao's dissimilarity coefficient
- [`divc()`](divc.md) : Rao's diversity coefficient also called
  quadratic entropy
- [`divcmax()`](divcmax.md) : Maximal value of Rao's diversity
  coefficient also called quadratic entropy
- [`dpcoa()`](dpcoa.md) [`plot(`*`<dpcoa>`*`)`](dpcoa.md)
  [`print(`*`<dpcoa>`*`)`](dpcoa.md)
  [`summary(`*`<dpcoa>`*`)`](dpcoa.md) : Double principal coordinate
  analysis
- [`originality()`](originality.md) : Originality of a species
- [`randtest(`*`<dpcoa>`*`)`](randtest.dpcoa.md) : Permutation test for
  double principal coordinate analysis (DPCoA)
- [`randtest(`*`<amova>`*`)`](randtest.amova.md) : Permutation tests on
  an analysis of molecular variance (in C).

### Spatial

Functions focusing on the analysis of spatial data. See also the package
`adespatial` for more functionalities.

- [`gridrowcol()`](gridrowcol.md) : Complete regular grid analysis
- [`mld()`](mld.md) [`haar2level()`](mld.md) : Multi Level Decomposition
  of unidimensional data
- [`mstree()`](mstree.md) : Minimal Spanning Tree
- [`orthobasis.neig()`](orthobasis.md)
  [`orthobasis.line()`](orthobasis.md)
  [`orthobasis.circ()`](orthobasis.md)
  [`orthobasis.mat()`](orthobasis.md)
  [`orthobasis.haar()`](orthobasis.md)
  [`print(`*`<orthobasis>`*`)`](orthobasis.md)
  [`plot(`*`<orthobasis>`*`)`](orthobasis.md)
  [`summary(`*`<orthobasis>`*`)`](orthobasis.md)
  [`is.orthobasis()`](orthobasis.md) : Orthonormal basis for orthonormal
  transform
- [`neig()`](neig.md) [`scores.neig()`](neig.md)
  [`print(`*`<neig>`*`)`](neig.md) [`summary(`*`<neig>`*`)`](neig.md)
  [`nb2neig()`](neig.md) [`neig2nb()`](neig.md) [`neig2mat()`](neig.md)
  : Neighbourhood Graphs

## Phylogenetic methods

These functions allows to manage phylogenetic data. See functions of the
package `adephylo` for a more flexible implementation based on `ape` and
`phylobase`.

- [`dotchart.phylog()`](dotchart.phylog.md) : Representation of many
  quantitative variables in front of a phylogenetic tree
- [`plot(`*`<phylog>`*`)`](plot.phylog.md)
  [`radial.phylog()`](plot.phylog.md) [`enum.phylog()`](plot.phylog.md)
  : Plot phylogenies
- [`gearymoran()`](gearymoran.md) : Moran's I and Geary'c randomization
  tests for spatial and phylogenetic autocorrelation
- [`newick2phylog()`](newick2phylog.md)
  [`hclust2phylog()`](newick2phylog.md)
  [`taxo2phylog()`](newick2phylog.md)
  [`newick2phylog.addtools()`](newick2phylog.md) : Create phylogeny
- [`print(`*`<phylog>`*`)`](phylog.md) [`phylog.extract()`](phylog.md)
  [`phylog.permut()`](phylog.md) : Phylogeny
- [`symbols.phylog()`](symbols.phylog.md) : Representation of a
  quantitative variable in front of a phylogenetic tree
- [`table.phylog()`](table.phylog.md) : Plot arrays in front of a
  phylogenetic tree
- [`variance.phylog()`](variance.phylog.md) : The phylogenetic ANOVA
- [`PI2newick()`](PI2newick.md) : Import data files from Phylogenetic
  Independance Package

## Tests

Utilities functions to manage results of randomization procedures.

- [`as.krandboot()`](randboot.md)
  [`print(`*`<krandboot>`*`)`](randboot.md)
  [`as.randboot()`](randboot.md)
  [`print(`*`<randboot>`*`)`](randboot.md) [`randboot()`](randboot.md) :
  Bootstrap simulations
- [`as.krandtest()`](krandtest.md)
  [`plot(`*`<krandtest>`*`)`](krandtest.md)
  [`print(`*`<krandtest>`*`)`](krandtest.md)
  [`` `[`( ``*`<krandtest>`*`)`](krandtest.md)
  [`` `[[`( ``*`<krandtest>`*`)`](krandtest.md) : Class of the
  Permutation Tests (in C).
- [`as.krandxval()`](randxval.md)
  [`print(`*`<krandxval>`*`)`](randxval.md)
  [`as.randxval()`](randxval.md)
  [`print(`*`<randxval>`*`)`](randxval.md) : Two-fold cross-validation
- [`randtest()`](randtest.md) [`as.randtest()`](randtest.md)
  [`plot(`*`<randtest>`*`)`](randtest.md)
  [`print(`*`<randtest>`*`)`](randtest.md) : Class of the Permutation
  Tests (in C).
- [`rtest()`](rtest.md) : Class of the Permutation Tests (in R).

## Misc

- [`ade4-package`](ade4.package.md) [`ade4`](ade4.package.md) : The ade4
  package
- [`dudi.acm()`](dudi.acm.md) [`acm.burt()`](dudi.acm.md)
  [`acm.disjonctif()`](dudi.acm.md)
  [`boxplot(`*`<acm>`*`)`](dudi.acm.md) : Multiple Correspondence
  Analysis
- [`adegraphicsLoaded()`](adegraphicsLoaded.md) : Utility function to
  test if the adegraphics package is loaded
- [`bicenter.wt()`](bicenter.wt.md) : Double Weighted Centring
- [`covwt()`](scalewt.md) [`varwt()`](scalewt.md)
  [`scalewt()`](scalewt.md) [`meanfacwt()`](scalewt.md)
  [`varfacwt()`](scalewt.md) [`covfacwt()`](scalewt.md)
  [`scalefacwt()`](scalewt.md) : Compute or scale data using (weighted)
  means, variances and covariances (possibly for the levels of a factor)
- [`dagnelie.test()`](dagnelie.test.md) : Dagnelie multinormality test
- [`uniquewt.df()`](uniquewt.df.md) : Elimination of Duplicated Rows in
  a Array

## Datasets

Datasets available in ade4. You can access them by typing
`r data(dataset)`.

- [`abouheif.eg`](abouheif.eg.md) : Phylogenies and quantitative traits
  from Abouheif
- [`acacia`](acacia.md) : Spatial pattern analysis in plant communities
- [`aminoacyl`](aminoacyl.md) : Codon usage
- [`apis108`](apis108.md) : Allelic frequencies in ten honeybees
  populations at eight microsatellites loci
- [`aravo`](aravo.md) : Distribution of Alpine plants in Aravo
  (Valloire, France)
- [`ardeche`](ardeche.md) : Fauna Table with double (row and column)
  partitioning
- [`arrival`](arrival.md) : Arrivals at an intensive care unit
- [`atlas`](atlas.md) : Small Ecological Dataset
- [`atya`](atya.md) : Genetic variability of Cacadors
- [`avijons`](avijons.md) : Bird species distribution
- [`avimedi`](avimedi.md) : Fauna Table for Constrained Ordinations
- [`aviurba`](aviurba.md) : Ecological Tables Triplet
- [`bacteria`](bacteria.md) : Genomes of 43 Bacteria
- [`banque`](banque.md) : Table of Factors
- [`baran95`](baran95.md) : African Estuary Fishes
- [`bf88`](bf88.md) : Cubic Ecological Data
- [`bordeaux`](bordeaux.md) : Wine Tasting
- [`bsetal97`](bsetal97.md) : Ecological and Biological Traits
- [`buech`](buech.md) : Buech basin
- [`butterfly`](butterfly.md) : Genetics-Ecology-Environment Triple
- [`capitales`](capitales.md) : Road Distances
- [`carni19`](carni19.md) : Phylogeny and quantative trait of carnivora
- [`carni70`](carni70.md) : Phylogeny and quantitative traits of
  carnivora
- [`carniherbi49`](carniherbi49.md) : Taxonomy, phylogenies and
  quantitative traits of carnivora and herbivora
- [`casitas`](casitas.md) : Enzymatic polymorphism in Mus musculus
- [`chatcat`](chatcat.md) : Qualitative Weighted Variables
- [`chats`](chats.md) : Pair of Variables
- [`chazeb`](chazeb.md) : Charolais-Zebus
- [`chevaine`](chevaine.md) : Enzymatic polymorphism in Leuciscus
  cephalus
- [`chickenk`](chickenk.md) : Veterinary epidemiological study to assess
  the risk factors for losses in broiler chickens
- [`clementines`](clementines.md) : Fruit Production
- [`cnc2003`](cnc2003.md) : Frequenting movie theaters in France in 2003
- [`coleo`](coleo.md) : Table of Fuzzy Biological Traits
- [`corvus`](corvus.md) : Corvus morphology
- [`deug`](deug.md) : Exam marks for some students
- [`doubs`](doubs.md) : Pair of Ecological Tables
- [`dunedata`](dunedata.md) : Dune Meadow Data
- [`ecg`](ecg.md) : Electrocardiogram data
- [`ecomor`](ecomor.md) : Ecomorphological Convergence
- [`elec88`](elec88.md) : Electoral Data
- [`escopage`](escopage.md) : K-tables of wine-tasting
- [`euro123`](euro123.md) : Triangular Data
- [`fission`](fission.md) : Fission pattern and heritable morphological
  traits
- [`friday87`](friday87.md) : Faunistic K-tables
- [`fruits`](fruits.md) : Pair of Tables
- [`ggtortoises`](ggtortoises.md) : Microsatellites of Galapagos
  tortoises populations
- [`granulo`](granulo.md) : Granulometric Curves
- [`hdpg`](hdpg.md) : Genetic Variation In Human Populations
- [`houmousr`](houmousr.md) : Morphometric data set
- [`housetasks`](housetasks.md) : Contingency Table
- [`humDNAm`](humDNAm.md) : human mitochondrial DNA restriction data
- [`ichtyo`](ichtyo.md) : Point sampling of fish community
- [`irishdata`](irishdata.md) : Geary's Irish Data
- [`julliot`](julliot.md) : Seed dispersal
- [`jv73`](jv73.md) : K-tables Multi-Regions
- [`kcponds`](kcponds.md) : Ponds in a nature reserve
- [`lascaux`](lascaux.md) : Genetic/Environment and types of variables
- [`lizards`](lizards.md) : Phylogeny and quantitative traits of lizards
- [`macaca`](macaca.md) : Landmarks
- [`macon`](macon.md) : Wine Tasting
- [`macroloire`](macroloire.md) : Assemblages of Macroinvertebrates in
  the Loire River (France)
- [`mafragh`](mafragh.md) : Phyto-Ecological Survey
- [`maples`](maples.md) : Phylogeny and quantitative traits of flowers
- [`mariages`](mariages.md) : Correspondence Analysis Table
- [`meau`](meau.md) : Ecological Data : sites-variables, sites-species,
  where and when
- [`meaudret`](meaudret.md) : Ecological Data : sites-variables,
  sites-species, where and when
- [`microsatt`](microsatt.md) : Genetic Relationships between cattle
  breeds with microsatellites
- [`mjrochet`](mjrochet.md) : Phylogeny and quantitative traits of
  teleos fishes
- [`mollusc`](mollusc.md) : Faunistic Communities and Sampling
  Experiment
- [`monde84`](monde84.md) : Global State of the World in 1984
- [`morphosport`](morphosport.md) : Athletes' Morphology
- [`newick.eg`](newick.eg.md) : Phylogenetic trees in Newick format
- [`njplot`](njplot.md) : Phylogeny and trait of bacteria
- [`olympic`](olympic.md) : Olympic Decathlon
- [`oribatid`](oribatid.md) : Oribatid mite
- [`ours`](ours.md) : A table of Qualitative Variables
- [`palm`](palm.md) : Phylogenetic and quantitative traits of amazonian
  palm trees
- [`pap`](pap.md) : Taxonomy and quantitative traits of carnivora
- [`pcw`](pcw.md) : Distribution of of tropical trees along the Panama
  canal
- [`perthi02`](perthi02.md) : Contingency Table with a partition in
  Molecular Biology
- [`piosphere`](piosphere.md) : Plant traits response to grazing
- [`presid2002`](presid2002.md) : Results of the French presidential
  elections of 2002
- [`procella`](procella.md) : Phylogeny and quantitative traits of birds
- [`rankrock`](rankrock.md) : Ordination Table
- [`rhizobium`](rhizobium.md) : Genetic structure of two nitrogen fixing
  bacteria influenced by geographical isolation and host specialization
- [`rhone`](rhone.md) : Physico-Chemistry Data
- [`rpjdl`](rpjdl.md) : Avifauna and Vegetation
- [`santacatalina`](santacatalina.md) : Indirect Ordination
- [`sarcelles`](sarcelles.md) : Array of Recapture of Rings
- [`seconde`](seconde.md) : Students and Subjects
- [`skulls`](skulls.md) : Morphometric Evolution
- [`steppe`](steppe.md) : Transect in the Vegetation
- [`syndicats`](syndicats.md) : Two Questions asked on a Sample of 1000
  Respondents
- [`t3012`](t3012.md) : Average temperatures of 30 French cities
- [`tarentaise`](tarentaise.md) : Mountain Avifauna
- [`taxo.eg`](taxo.eg.md) : Examples of taxonomy
- [`tintoodiel`](tintoodiel.md) : Tinto and Odiel estuary geochemistry
- [`tithonia`](tithonia.md) : Phylogeny and quantitative traits of
  flowers
- [`tortues`](tortues.md) : Morphological Study of the Painted Turtle
- [`toxicity`](toxicity.md) : Homogeneous Table
- [`trichometeo`](trichometeo.md) : Pair of Ecological Data
- [`ungulates`](ungulates.md) : Phylogeny and quantitative traits of
  ungulates.
- [`vegtf`](vegtf.md) : Vegetation in Trois-Fontaines
- [`veuvage`](veuvage.md) : Example for Centring in PCA
- [`westafrica`](westafrica.md) : Freshwater fish zoogeography in west
  Africa
- [`woangers`](woangers.md) : Plant assemblages in woodlands of the
  conurbation of Angers (France)
- [`worksurv`](worksurv.md) : French Worker Survey (1970)
- [`yanomama`](yanomama.md) : Distance Matrices
- [`zealand`](zealand.md) : Road distances in New-Zealand

## Deprecated

- [`ade4-deprecated`](ade4-deprecated.md) : Deprecated functions in ade4
- [`plot(`*`<between>`*`)`](plot.between.md)
  [`print(`*`<between>`*`)`](plot.between.md)
  [`plot(`*`<betcoi>`*`)`](plot.between.md)
  [`print(`*`<betcoi>`*`)`](plot.between.md)
  [`summary(`*`<between>`*`)`](plot.between.md) : Between-Class Analysis
- [`plot(`*`<within>`*`)`](plot.within.md)
  [`print(`*`<within>`*`)`](plot.within.md)
  [`plot(`*`<witcoi>`*`)`](plot.within.md)
  [`print(`*`<witcoi>`*`)`](plot.within.md)
  [`summary(`*`<within>`*`)`](plot.within.md) : Within-Class Analysis
